title.narrative: Fourth National Communication and the Third Biennial Update Report

description.narrative: Assist the Macedonian Government to prepare the Fourth National Communication and the Third Biennial Update Report on Climate Change for the fulfillment of its obligations towards the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC)

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Outcome Indicator 1, reff. baseline [1] System to access, deliver, monitor, report on and verify climate finance in place
Outcome Indicator 2, reff. baseline [2] Extent to which implementation of comprehensive measures - plans, strategies, policies, programmes and budgets – to achieve low-emission and climate-resilient development objectives has improved
Indicator 3, reff. baseline [1] Country has data-informed development and investment plans that incorporate integrated solutions and enable climate change adaptation and mitigation, taking into consideration gender perspectives;
Indicator 4, reff. baseline [2] % of stakeholders, gender disaggregated, that have increased knowledge and awareness on climate change issues
Indicator 5, reff. baseline [2] # of knowledge products and innovative tools for collection of data
Indicator 6, reff. baseline [1] System for Monitoring, Reporting and Verification (MRV) of climate action in place
Indicator 7, reff. baseline [2] An integrated Gender and Climate Action Plan endorsed and implemented

comment.narrative:
[1] No system in place to access, deliver, monitor, report on and verify climate finance
[2] Low level of implementation of policies, strategies, plans and programmes

- 3 BUR adopted by the Government and submitted to UNFCCC in June 2021; Technical revision of the 3BUR by the UNFCCC Secretariat is underway [o] - A separate policy brief has been developed, highlighting the technical and financial potential for “green” cooling technologies and practices in the Republic of North Macedonia [p] -Assessment of the potential and benefits of climate-resilient infrastructure in the Republic of North Macedonia is underway, in order to support the adaptation of the infrastructure to the expected climate change, as well as implementation of the Macedonian enhanced Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) targets. The scope of this assessment includes transportation infrastructure (roads, rails, and ports), energy infrastructure (generation, transmission, and distribution), water infrastructure (water supply, wastewater transportation and treatment, and dam safety), and the built environment (building regulations, housing, land use planning and zoning, and public buildings including schools and healthcare facilities) [p] - Web GIS application has been developed to support mainstreaming climate change into spatial planning for development of the Macedonian Spatial Plan 2021-2041 [p] - Overlapping/complementarity between SENDAI, SDGs and UNFCC/Paris Agreement requirements on DRR reporting have been identified, especially on loss and damage; The findings served as baseline for development of sustainable solution for data collection in all three areas i.e. upgrade of the existing platform in the Center for Crisis Management [p] -Economic aspects of the vulnerability to climate change for maize and soil conservation practices have been analyzed, showcasing the need to introduce new soil adaptation practices in the country [p] - Livelihood vulnerability index has been developed for all municipalities in the country, pinpointing municipalities in the northeast as most vulnerable to climate change [p] - Procurement call for a company to develop a rapid assessment of the food-energy-water nexus in the context of climate change impact in the Republic of North Macedonia has been re-announced, as the first call has been unsuccessful. A company is expected to be contracted by the end of the 2021, and to initiate work in Jan 2022 [r] - Sex-disaggregated data and gender indicators in Vulnerability and Adaptation assessment have been proposed [t] - Micronarratives` findings on reports on the individual activities women and men undertook were analyzed by their vulnerability. Following categories of vulnerability cross-referenced by gender were: Single mothers living in houses with children under the age of 18, using firewood, Single fathers living in houses with children under the age of 18, using firewood, Women 65+ age, with monthly income beyond 12.000 MKD single, divorced or widower and live alone, Men 65+ age, with monthly income beyond 12.000 MKD, single, divorced or widower and live alone [s] - Rapid assessment of the existing level of climate change or sustainable development topics integrated in the Macedonian education system and educational programs at all three education levels (primary, secondary and university education) has been finalized, as well as state accredited programs for adult education i.e. non-formal trainings. In addition, the consultant shall recommend corrective actions and pinpoint entry points for incorporation of “climate literacy” into the national education system at all levels and all types. [t]

- 3 BUR finalized and submitted to the Government for adoption, presenting clear vision for a systemic change based on sound scientific research and the existing robust and comprehensive GHG inventory [h] - MRV relevant indicators identified. Development of national MRV platform initiated [i] - Green cooling scenario developed in close coordination with relevant stakeholders [j] - Extreme climate events modelled for the country and for 3 selected cities/region (Skopje, Strumica, Polog region) [k] - Based on the extreme weather events scenarios, vulnerability and adaptation in various sectors are underway, identifying the bottlenecks and recommend actions for improvement [l] - Climate Change public awareness survey has been conducted, reflecting increased interest among Macedonian citizens from various age and background on climate change issues, especially the extreme weather events.Public awareness campaign “The climate is changing, why aren`t you?” was conducted in the period from January to June 2020. In six months, according to Google Analytics, significant results have been achieved according to the number of new users, the number of sessions per user and open pages with views [m] - Gender perspective was captured through developing and proposing a set of indicators in the following requested areas of the 3rd BUR: the greenhouse gas (GHG) inventory, Actions to mitigate GHG emissions and Monitoring, Reporting, and Verification (MRV), that will enable monitoring of gender issues in priority mitigation areas. The 3rd BUR is the first national report that includes a separate Chapter (5.3) on social aspects-gender with concrete measures to make the Climate Change Mitigation Process more Gender Responsive. [n]

[d] Project board established and regular meting(s) held as planned within the project document. [e] National GHG Inventory updated up to 2016 and validated. [f] Mitigation scenarios developed within the SBUR updated as per the revised energy balances and new Energy Strategy. [g] The process of establishment of the domestic Measurement, Reporting and Verification arrangements supported.

Project board established and two regular meetings held due to changes on senior management level in the Ministry of Environment and Physical Planning. The project board approved the 2020 AWP. [d]
National GHG Inventory was updated up to 2016 and validated. Time series have been improved. The process for development of GHG inventories and mitigation actions has been completely institutionalized, thus providing sustainability to the process of reporting towards UNFCCC. [e]
Mitigation scenarios developed within the SBUR have been updated as per the revised energy balances and new Energy Strategy, setting more ambitious mitigation target for the country. Additionally, mainstreaming climate change into sectoral policies has been supported for two most important mitigation sectors: energy (the country adopted its first Energy Strategy merging energy and climate considerations) and transport (change of vehicle legislation to take into consideration CO2 emissions from vehicles). The mitigation scenarios from the SBUR served as baseline for the new Energy Strategy and were additionally upgraded for a more ambitious target (up to 60% reduction from the baseline scenario). [f]
Climate Change public awareness survey has been conducted, reflecting increased interest among Macedonian citizens from various age and background on climate change issues, especially the extreme weather events. The results pinpoint UNDP as a key climate change player. [f]
The legal bases for establishment of the domestic Measurement, Reporting and Verification arrangements has been closely supported through close cooperation with the ongoing IPA funded project for development of Law and Strategy on Climate Action.[g]
As a result of the effective UNDP support that contributed towards a culture of evidence-based decision-making, informed policies and programmes in the country, the Government entrusted UNDP the key role for enhanced action by the Paris Agreement: to provide support for NDC revision through its Climate Promise initiative. (reff.Indicator 3, baseline [1])
